steps.title: â€œSnatchedâ€ comes from the Black drag community.
steps.content: â€œSnatchedâ€ comes from the Black drag community. â€œSnatchedâ€ originated in the New York City drag scene in the 1990s as a way to describe things as â€œfierceâ€ or â€œon point.â€ Because Black drag performers typically wear artificial hair in the form of wigs or weaves, they might say that another performer â€œsnatched their wigâ€ off when they did something amazing or flawless. [3] X Research source The slang term â€œsnatchedâ€ eventually began to be used on its own, most likely being popularized around 2016 by the reality TV show RuPaulâ€™s Drag Race . Although â€œsnatchedâ€ has become popular in the mainstream, the word was (and still is) predominately used in the Black drag community. People in the drag world may also use â€œsnatchedâ€ to mean that someone is being extra sassy or witty, but this meaning hasnâ€™t been as popularized in wider communities.
